com.printnode.api

Class APIClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.printnode.api.APIClient

  • public class APIClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main class used in PrintNode-Java. Controls every request.

      • deleteAccount

        public final boolean deleteAccount()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes account. This can only be used when specified a child account is specified by email, id or creatorRef. Otherwise, will throw an APIException as the response will throw a non 2xx status code.
        Returns:
        Boolean whether account was deleted or not.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if HTTP client is given bad values
        See Also:
        APIException

      • modifyClientDownloads

        public final int[] modifyClientDownloads(java.lang.String clientSet,
                          boolean enabled)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Given a set of clients, such as "10-15" or "10,11,13" or just "10", will set whether clients in the set are enabled. If you are unsure what is possible for clientSet, check the PrintNode API docs on printnode.com.
        Parameters:
        clientSet - set of clients as a string.
        enabled - whether you are disabling or enabling the clients.
        Returns:
        An array of ids relative to clients with changed values.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if HTTP client is given bad values

      • modifyAccount

        public final Whoami modifyAccount(Account accountInfo)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Given an Account object, modifies an account. This can only be used when a child account is specified by email, id or creatorRef.
        Parameters:
        accountInfo - account object. Requires atleast one value set. Having id set will throw an exception, unless set to -1.
        Returns:
        Whoami object of the modified account.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if HTTP client is given bad values
        See Also:
        Account, Whoami

      • createTag

        public final java.lang.String createTag(java.lang.String tagName,
                         java.lang.String tagValue)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Given a name and value for a tag, creates that tag.
        Parameters:
        tagName - name of tag.
        tagValue - value of tag.
        Returns:
        String which will be "created" when no errors happen.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if HTTP client is given bad values

      • createAccount

        public final CreateAccountObject createAccount(CreateAccountJson accountInfo)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Given a CreateAccountJson object, creates an account.
        Parameters:
        accountInfo - CreateAccountJson object with values set.
        Returns:
        CreateAccountObject. This is practically the same as the CreateAccountJson object with some other additions.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if HTTP client is given bad values
        See Also:
        CreateAccountJson, CreateAccountObject, Account

      • getLatestClient

        public final Download getLatestClient(java.lang.String os)
                               throws APIException,
                                      java.io.IOException
        Given the OS of the client as a string, returns the latest available client. The parameter can ONLY be "osx" or "windows". either can have any case, so "OSX" or "Windows" also works.
        Parameters:
        os - os of client requested as a string.
        Returns:
        object of the request.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if HTTP client is given bad values
        APIException - if OS is not 'osx' or 'windows'
        See Also:
        Download

      • getPrintersByComputers

        public final Printer[] getPrintersByComputers(java.lang.String computerSet,
                               java.lang.String printerSet)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Given a set of computers, and a set of printers, return an array of printers relative to the set of computers. If computerSet is a blank string, this will throw an APIException.
        Parameters:
        computerSet - set of computers.
        printerSet - set of printers.
        Returns:
        Array of Printers.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if HTTP client is given bad values
        See Also:
        Printer

      • getClientKey

        public final java.lang.String getClientKey(java.lang.String uuid,
                            java.lang.String edition,
                            java.lang.String version)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Given a UUID, a client edition, and a client version, returns a client-key.
        Parameters:
        uuid - the UUID.
        edition - The edition of the client the client-key refers to.
        version - the version of client being used.
        Returns:
        a client key for the speicfied arguments.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if HTTP client is given bad values

        Parameters:
